Roundtrip

    present videos

    Playing video on a web page seems not that special since you can already watch videos on web pages through plugins like Flash Player, Quicktime or Silverlight. A new standard goes to HTML5 Video, a pure HTML way to show video on the web; instead of the previous de facto standard of using proprietary software.

    Video Galleries

    HTML5 Video open the doors to your way presenting video content. Modern browsers support the video tag <video> for the HTML5 Video standard. Browsers have a build-in multimedia framework already for decoding and displaying video content. No need to use such proprietary software components anymore!

    HTML5 Video support is given by the App gallery combined with the Lightbox LightGallery.

    Two types of video sources are supported:

    1. videos from local files (your web space)

    2. videos from online sources (on the Internet) like YouTube, Vimeo, etc.

    The combination of the App gallery and the lightbox LightGallery is quite usable for all the video content you want to present on your site. Galleries can be placed elsewhere with your content. You can use them for video blogs for example by placing them into your blog articles content.

    LightGallery can be used for free for private use but for business use, a commercial license is needed. See Light Gallery license how to use LightGallery for commercial webs and projects.

    Local video content

    Digital image content, simple pictures or vidoes, are quite easy to make. Today, each and every mobile has a camera - not that bad! Presenting a bunch of (digital) pictures is very easy by using Justified Gallery for example. Videos created by a digi cam or a mobile can played by J1 Template using the HTML5 Video support of LightGallery.

    Two players are available with LightGallery:

    1. an internal player used by default

    2. video.js, a excellent Javascript video library

    The HTML5 specification does not define which video and audio formats browsers should support. J1 LightGallery supports all typical types of HTML5 Video formats browsers support today such as MP4, WebM, and Ogg.
    HTML5 video gallery

    Online video content

    The Internet is full of interesting content. Video content is very popular, the number of channels at e.g. YouTube is enormous. If you want to present video content from the Internet, e.g. your channnel, the online video support of J1 Template may a good choice. Find some enjoyable videos from James Cordon’s channel: Carpool Karaoke.

    YouTube Video Gallery - Carpool Karaoke
    Vimeo Video Gallery - Fashion

    Whats next

    Images and videos are quite visual - and could be impressive, for sure. But the most visual component is text for all pages, for all sites on the Internet. To see how text could be presented great for modern responsive websites, check the section Typography next.

    What? Find out how it works. go for: Typography.
